headline: Easy Baked Tilapia
description: This baked tilapia recipe with simple ingredients is super easy to prepare, and ready in 30 minutes for a quick and delicious weeknight meal.

video.description: Prepare a healthy and delicious meal in just a handful of minutes.
video.name: Easy Baked Tilapia

name: Easy Baked Tilapia
recipeIngredient: 0.5 teaspoon garlic salt, or to taste
0.25 teaspoon seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay¬Æ), or to taste
1 (16 ounce) package frozen cauliflower with broccoli and red pepper
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees F). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Place tilapia fillets in the bottom of the baking dish, then dot with butter and season with garlic salt and seafood seasoning.
Top each fillet with a slice or two of lemon.
Arrange frozen mixed vegetables around fillets and season lightly with salt and pepper. Cover the dish with aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven until vegetables are tender and fish flakes easily with a fork, 25 to 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I made changes according to reviews - used 4 pieces of tilapia in a 9 by 13 pan and presoaked the fish in italian dressing - it took 1 hr for my fish and frozen veggies to be done. Yes I put all the italian dressing in with the fish and veggies - added the lemon juice and Old bay seasoning before cooking - it was good and served the juice over rice.
It was very good the fish was perfect awesome I will recommend it always
I made it & it was really flavorful! The pan was gone quickly! ;)

Oh My Gosh this was wonderful and easy to make!! Both my boys turned their nose up when they heard I was making fish, but polished off their plates and were sniffing around for seconds!!! Served the fish and veggies (I used stir fry blend) over unconverted white rice and it was wonderful!!!
Depending on the size of the cooking dish and the material, the Easy-Baked Tilapia may need more time to cook. I am using a Teflon pan.

It was good for being so easy. I didn‚Äôt measure my Old Bay or garlic salt because I measure those with my heart (i.e. a lot.) I would recommend putting effort into your rice and be careful on which frozen veggies you buy, Green Giant is always good. :)

This recipe has become part of our dinner rotation. I‚Äôve varied the seasoning by replacing the Old Bay (I had run out) with Lawry‚Äôs Seasoned Salt and freshly ground pepper üëçüèªas well as Kinder‚Äôs Buttery Steakhouseüëçüèª
I'm not a fan of frozen vegetables, but I really liked adding them to this recipe. The lemon on the tilapia infused into the vegetables making them yummy!
Added spinach and tomatoes . My wife preferred spicier or it would get five stars. I liked it better than the spicey recipe.
The fish was tasty. The veggies were mediocre. I'd appreciate others in the community's suggestions for complimentary veggies. Thanks
We love this!!! I add breadcrumbs and parm. So fast, easy and crowd pleasing!

I made it exactly as written - except (don‚Äôt you hate that) I only had broccoli so that‚Äôs what I used. The fish was delicious as was the veggie. My husband, a down south fried fish kinda guy, enjoyed it as well. Thanks for a healthy recipe!

I LOVED THIS. It was quick, easy, healthy and WONDERFUL. 
I didn't have the Old Bay so I just substituted some other herbs and spices. 
It really turned out great to have spent such little prep time.
Will definitely make again.

Great recipe! Didn't have cauliflower, so just used frozen broccoli. Added a couple of slices of lemon on top of that also. Fish comes out light and flaky, broccoli sweet and just right at 30 minutes. Uncovered the last 5 minutes to brown a bit.
My wife loved this and said she for sure want's me to fix this again and serve over rice
Excellent!

It's definitely a good starter to just about any meal with tilapia as the protein. I didn't have any frozen mixed vegetables and I like garlic so I sliced a couple cloves and threw them in. I over seasoned, like I often do, but it's hard to go wrong with garlic and old bay on seafood.
I put a salad next to this with oil, vinegar, and oregeno and it was a delicious meal.
Family loved this! I used broccoli instead of cauliflower because I already had it.
Thank you for this recipe. Easy and delicious and healthy. My husband loved it.
QUICK & EASY LOVED IT
Good, Healthy, and Easy!
I really enjoyed this! I added fresh vegetables, but I think it would have been better with the frozen ones.

Easy definitely and the taste is great on Tilapia or cod or whatever I can get. However, loss of 1 star because I cannot find the Bay seasoning anywhere. I use hot paprika, salt, and pepper or whatever seasoning I think we will like. Very easy meal to make

This dish turned out well and tasted good. The fish was moist and flavorful. I couldn't find the veggie blend recommended, so I used a California medley (broccoli, cauliflower and carrots) instead. I had to cook the fish for 10 mins longer than recommended. 4 starts because it turned out well and I'd make it again but it's just a pretty basic meal, not blow your socks off good. It's easy to put together and makes for a good weeknight meal.
Easy and very tasty

Actually I just salted peppered added season salt to both sides and lemon juice and just baked for 15 minutes at 350. Very basic. Sideed with white rice and microwave frozen broccoli. Esze peze 
My first trying fresh fish...
This was VERY good ! I've made it a few times already it's sooo easy!
Quite yummy! Happy to have this in the rotation of possible tilapia dinners.
Quite yummy! Happy to have this in the rotation of possible tilapia dinners.

Very good recipe. The only thing I didn't like was the frozen vegetables, they were not softened by the time the fish was done. I doubled the recipe, which might have made a difference, because I had no idea how I should adjust the cooking time. Anyway, next time I will use fresh veggies instead.
The fish turned out nice and flaky . 14 year old and I Didn't care for the bay seasoning. Hubby liked it and cleaned his plate.
I have been making Zappa Toscano Soup for years. It is as good as The Olive Gardens. Love it,and my family loves it too!
Absolutely love this dish and so easy! Made some jasmin rice with it. Yummy!
Absolutely love this dish and so easy! Made some jasmin rice with it. Yummy!
VERY quick & easy to make! I purchased frozen Tilapia and used frozen broccoli & cauliflower. My kids said it looked like it came from a restaurant.
loved it awsome
I have made is recipe about once a week since Ive discovered it. SO SIMPLE YET SO GOOD! The Oldbay really gives a great flavor and the lemon just ads the perfect amount of zest.

Nice to have a recipe that doesn't have breading of any type. It was easy to have a one dish meal like this. We don't use garlic salt so used garlic powder, otherwise all the same to recipe. Next time we won't add salt/pepper to veggies because I thought it seemed salty enough & if needed can always add individually. 3/19/20 just made again, but used fresh broc & carrots as the veggies. Even using a whole lemon isn't to much like I thought it might be, use it all for 4 tilapia.
This was a total hit with my hubby! We're trying to eat healthier by laying off the heavy meals. This was tasty and satisfying.
This was so delish. I only added a little Old Bay Hot Sauce to the recipe for a little kick.
Lacks flavor.

I usually do not care for fish unless it is battered or breaded but this was excellent. I love the spices and red peppers with the fish. I too did not have lemons so I used my spice lemon peel spread over it and veggies. I tried to stay as true as possible to the original recipe. I will make this. again!!
I really loved this. I ended up using fresh vegetables - zucchini, tomato and red pepper, but otherwise followed the recipe as written. It was fast and tasty.
Excellent easy quick healthy dinner (delish)
The Old Bay Seasoning was fantastic!

We usually flour & fry tilapia, but this brings out more of the taste. I substituted EVO for the butter & "Spike" for the Old Bay Seasoning. Excellent, will certainly do this again. I liked the ease of using the oven and foil, and it will be a long time before I stand over a frying pan again.
Very easy and delicious! I didn't have mixed veggies so I used frozen broccoli. Turned out great.
Excellent....
used exact r
I really liked it - only had a meyer lemon, used that, would like to use reg. lemon sometime.
Delicious and very easy to make. It will be one of my favorites dishes!
Baked tilapia was delicious and easy to make. I would recommend this recipe to others.
My husband, who is not a tilapia fan, really liked this recipe! It was flavorful and flaky.
This recipe was ok but next time I make it I think I‚Äôll add more seasoning and lay the lemon beside the fish instead of on top. The vegetables were perfect!!
I used 2 tbsp of lime juice in place of half of the olive oil. It was nice and crunchy.
We made no changes to the recipe and will definitely make it again
I added just a little more seasoning and fresh carrots.
Very easy, and very delicious.
I made a slight change by using both fresh cauliflower and red peppers in the skillet.

This is an easy and delicious recipe. I didn‚Äôt have fresh lemons so I substituted bottled lemon juice. Also, since Old Bay has quite a bit of salt in it I used garlic powder instead of garlic salt. One other thing, I added raw onion rings to it. I absolutely recommend it.
No changes, will never have Tilapia any other way. Thank you
Given how easy and healthy this is, I will be making it with some frequency.

I might make it, but it sure sounds like that's way to long to bake. Fish only takes 10 minutes per inch to cook through. I would precook the veggies and probably bake about 15 minutes at the most. (As Gailmellina stated, it was dry! )

I might make it, but it sure sounds like that's way to long to bake. Fish only takes 10 minutes per inch to cook through. I would precook the veggies and probably bake about 15 minutes at the most. (As Gailmellina stated, it was dry! )
very good ...but I used carrots and asparagus spears ‚Ä¶
Good
Well received by all, including my picky eater. Will make again!

This recipe is wonderful and so easy! I use frozen broccoli and frozen tilapia, sometimes I add 10 minutes to the cook time to make sure it's done. Always feel super healthy and put together when I make this!
I made it and it turned out really really really good what a great recipe thank you
I used Tony Chachere's creole seasoning and I seasoned the vegetables then added it to the baking pan with 4 pats of butter on the bottom of the dish.
Yummy, light quick and easy dinner. My husband had seconds!
Tasted great.

Good, but I will modify a bit next time. I used foil & Pam for the pan instead of grease, and didn't add butter. I will add just a dash of cayenne, 1/8 tsp pepper, 1/8 tsp paprika, 1/2 tsp garlic powder instead of salt, and only a splash of lemon juice. I will also try with fresh vegetables instead of partially thawed frozen veggies. I will stick to veggies on the sides of the fish or in a separate pan because veggies on the top made the fish not cook as quickly. I will cover the pan and cook for 15-20 minutes, then add Parmesan and bread crumbs and cook for 15-20 minutes more with no cover.
Light, very good flavor and perfect pairing of baked veggies.
Very tasty recipe easy and quick to make even for a beginner chef like me. Highly recommened!
Made exactly as recipe called for. Was delicious. So glad to find a new seasoning for tilapia.
So easy and very tasty!
Very easy to make and everyone in my enjoyed it, will be making it again
Added lemon pepper and garlic instead of Ol Bay. Yes I would make again.
Very easy!! Very delicious!!

Very simple recipe with lots of room to customize. I seasoned the filets with Tony Chachere's Creole Seasoning, dried parsley and garlic powder, and placed a pat of butter and sliced lemon on each filet. I also threw some raw asparagus in the baking dish as well. For the last 10 min of baking (out of 25) I sprinkled breadcrumbs on top of the filets.

Note: I used fresh veggies. I've tried based on the directions with frozen veggies but the fish didn't cook well, you should defrost beforehand.
Forgot the Old Bay but it was good anyway!
Easy weeknight dish!
Easy to make and very tasty.
This was a tasty and easy meal to make! I added Paprika for a little color, plus added flavor. I can't wait to make it again!

I have been on Weight Watchers and this dish was perfect for my diet. I made this for friends and family one night and everyone liked it. It was flavorful, easy to make and only 1 WW point per serving. I will definitely be making this again.
easy to make and delicious. nothing extravagant but everyone loved it. do mo squeeze the lemon afterwards it will bee too much

Absolutely love this recipe. So easy and the whole family loves it. I add whatever frozen veggies we are in the mood for and have in the freezer. Even gave this to my daughter who just moved out, as an easy yummy recipe for her and her roommate.
Very good. I was afraid it would be watery with the frozen veggies, but it came out perfect! Very tasty!

This recipe was pretty good. What I enjoyed about it was the riced cauliflower that I cooked in the pan with it. It soaked up a lot of the flavor and became "fluffy." The other frozen veggies I baked with it took much longer to cook from frozen so I had to remove them and continue baking in another pan.
This is very quick and easy and it came out very good. I made no changes to the recipe.
The dish was delicious. Turned very well, I added asparagus spears and cauliflower . Used Tony Chacheres Creole seasoning with a splash of lemon juice.

I love how easy it was to prepare! I only substituted the Old Spice for mixed spices local to my area, and used foil paper. Over the last 5-minutes, I removed the grill so it would become a little crispy. Delicious!

Melted butter and juiced half a lemon and added
Parsley to spread onto fish. Sprinkled salt pepper old bay and garlic powder. Added bread crumbs and fresh grated Romano with some extra parsley with 10 min left uncovered.
It was so yummy and it only took a few minutes to make.

I made this and it was delicious! I bought fresh tilapia from the market and decided to make a dish of it, rather than fry it as I usually do with frozen tilapia fillets. I really enjoyed this easy quick recipe. I didn't have old Bay seasoning, so I used my own seasoning. I added dill. I used frozen vegetables that I had on hand, peas and some fresh red bell peppers. Great dish that I will make again and again!??

This is one of the first recipes I made my husband 5 years ago and I still make it monthly. We love it as an easy option when we are looking for a light dinner. Pretty much any frozen veggies work in this and I serve it on top of rice to make it stretch a bit further. =)
Easy, fast and total perfect. the only thing I changed was the vegetables. Used broccoli and asparagus. Served with Batsami rice.

I love this recipe! The fish was flaky and the vegetables tender. I baked at 375* for 25 mins. However I forgot to cover it and it still came out perfect. (For weight watchers it‚Äôs a 0 point meal) So delicious I see myself making this a regular dish in my household! Thank you for this 5 star recipe!!!!
